conclusion: Understanding shadow formation and changes due to light source movement
Shadow A is cast by the cake, currently on the right side
Shadow B is cast by the small object, currently on the right side
Shadow C is cast by the roll of tape, currently on the right side
Shadow D is cast by the soccer ball, currently on the right side
Shadows will be cast in the opposite direction when the light source moves to the right
Shadow A will move to the left side of the cake
Shadow B will move to the left side of the small object
Shadow C will move to the left side of the roll of tape
Shadow D will move to the left side of the soccer ball
Shadow size depends on distance from the light source and surface
Shadow sizes will not change significantly if object positions remain constant
Final answer: Shadows will move to the left side of their respective objects
